Because it's a script, and if Riot disabled champs because scripters use them, we wouldn't even be having this discussion.

Scripts itself aren't the problem here, you can still kill scripters most of the time. It's the effectiveness of the script that's so dangerous. This is actually gamebreaking, this is not just "a little thing" or "This guy goes 20/3 as Vayne because he can perfectly dodge skillshots", it's Xerath globally taking everyone out of the game and ruining it for 9 other people. Hotfixing this doesn't fix how negatively it impacts the game and the players to go through that torture.

Here's a full breakdown of the bug, guys:

It is a combination of a script and a bug. The bug makes it so that if you have very precise position/timing or Xerath's Q, it will simulate hitboxes that auto-target every enemy within a large (but not global) range. I did some poking in Xerath's files and apparently this bug has existed for a long time but it requires _very _ precise timing to perform. The script just automates the timing process.

Still a hack/exploit and should be dealt with immediately.
I was first one to post it hours ago and Riot took it down messaging me that it was inappropriate.

Anyone know if this is a repeatable by anyone or if it requires some sort of 3rd party software?

Also, for anyone wondering:

https://youtu.be/cHGbDAkZ_xY

Someone shared a first person video on Twitter of someone using the script. It looks like it requires the player to be in a particular position on the map (in the video it showed a spot a little ahead of the Red Nexus towards bot lane). It's also got a chance to fail even if you're in the right spot. 

I'd be very curious how the bug/exploit/script combo works, but it's unlikely that'll be made public.
